text: Jayasimha I (641â€“673 CE) succeeded Kubja Vishnuvardhana as the king of Eastern Chalukyas. He had a long reign of 32 years.His younger brother Indra Bhattaraka succeeded him to the throne. == References == * Durga Prasad, History of the Andhras up to 1565 A. D., P. G. Publishers, Guntur (1988) * South Indian Inscriptions - * Nilakanta Sastri, K.A. (1955). A History of South India, OUP, New Delhi (Reprinted 2002). title: Jayasimha I (Eastern Chalukyas)
